body: @sijie How about move this into 2.5.0?
move this into 2.5.0, since PR has already moved.
@YangZunYu @sijie  How about move this into 2.5.0?
@sijie @rdhabalia Could we move it into 2.5.0?

Seems like `org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.conf.ProducerConfigurationData` throws the exception : 

```scala
import org.apache.flink.util.InstantiationUtil
import org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.conf.ProducerConfigurationData

val obj = new ProducerConfigurationData
InstantiationUtil.serializeObject(obj)
```

throws `Exception in thread "main" java.io.NotSerializableException: org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.DefaultBatcherBuilder`

(flink 1.8.1-2.12, pulsar 2.4.0)

Ended with a custom FlinkPulsarProducer with ProducerConfigurationData replaced with simple topic name.

Now, the go client depends on the cpp client. When we send the message every time, we will call the send of the cpp client to implement the real send function. In this process, a system call from go to c will occur, so there will be a certain performance issues.

Currently we use native go to rewrite pulsar's go client, the interface is consistent with the cgo client, the project address: https://github.com/apache/pulsar-client-go/, you can try to use this client to see if it can meet your performance requirements.

ping @merlimat @jerrypeng

> there are no partitions available in the broker,

@tcbuzor I am not sure if this is a problem. By default, when the used topic is not created, the specified topic is automatically created when the producer is created. We can modify this behavior in `broker.conf`:

```
# Enable topic auto creation if new producer or consumer connected (disable auto creation with value false)
allowAutoTopicCreation=true
```

Can you provide a simple code to stabilize this problem?
@MrBlueMoo It is a known bug in 2.4.0 when handling deleted schema. The issue is fixed by #4669 and will be released in 2.4.1. 2.4.1 is coming next week.

@frank-dkvan this is a known issue of #3828. because Pulsar doesn't flush LAC so when Presto SQL reads data from bookkeeper bypassing broker, it will miss the latest message because the advanced LAC is not flushed back. 

The fix is waiting for BK 4.10 release.
@guillaume-braibant +1

It seems to me that we can provide a flag to allow skipping the corrupted messages. 

/cc @codelipenghui @congbobo184
@sijie Sure, thanks for your reminder. Done.

@yittg LGTM
But there are some issues about parsing batch messages. When I test locally mac environment, pulsar-client shows that the installation was successful, but when I use `import pulsar`, it will cause the program to exit. I think in the dashboard, an option can be set to let the user decide whether to turn on parsing batch messages, this allows users to use dashboard even if pulsar-client is not installed.
@sijie Anyone is working on this? i would like to take it if not.

@tuteng 
> But there are some issues about parsing batch messages. When I test locally mac environment, pulsar-client shows that the installation was successful, but when I use `import pulsar`, it will cause the program to exit.

Did you check the compile environment and runtime consistency, i'm not sure what leads to this.

> I think in the dashboard, an option can be set to let the user decide whether to turn on parsing batch messages, this allows users to use dashboard even if pulsar-client is not installed.

yeah, it indeed does as what you describe. it would check whether the proper pulsar module was installed. I have not found a convenient way to set a dependency optional to avoid installing a lower version of pulsar-client, so i didn't limit its version in `requirements.txt`.
@sijie Thank you, thats good to hear, apologies I didn't notice the existing issue before raising!

> If the user created a partitioned topic with the same name after creating a non-partitioned topic with a '-partition-[number]' suffix, throw exception and prohibit creation.

+1 Pulsar should prohibit the creation of a partitioned topic with the same name if there is already a non-partitioned topic already exists.

run cpp tests
run integration tests
run java8 tests

you haven't built thee C++ libraries
http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/client-libraries-cpp#compilation

If you want to install the client before version 2.4.0, you need to install [libpulsar](http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/client-libraries-cpp/#macos) first and then use pip to install client.  
If you want to use source code installation, you need to compile the C++ library first refer to https://github.com/apache/pulsar/tree/master/pulsar-client-cpp#compile-on-mac-os-x.

@frank-dkvan 

The athenz dependencies are in yahoo's maven repo. 

The yahoo's maven repo is already defined in pulsar's root pom file. so please make sure you are able to access the maven repo.

```
  <repositories>
    <repository>
      <id>central</id>
      <layout>default</layout>
      <url>https://repo1.maven.org/maven2</url>
    </repository>
    <repository>
      <snapshots>
        <enabled>false</enabled>
      </snapshots>
      <id>bintray-yahoo-maven</id>
      <name>bintray</name>
      <url>https://yahoo.bintray.com/maven</url>
    </repository>
  </repositories>
```
Thank you, I've checked that with shared mode is works as expected. Closing the issue.

@congbobo184 I saw you worked on related things, do you have ideas about this issue?
And if it doesn't, does pulsar sql worker supports SslContextAutoRefreshBuilder?

From the PIP:

> Fixed number of messages
> 
> Consumer will be blocked until has enough number of messages available.
>
> `BatchReceivePolicy.builder().maxNumMessages(10).build();`

This is confusing. The method name `maxNumMessages` seems to mean "get 10 or less", but the description "has enough messages available" seems to imply "get 10 or more", but the phrase "Fixed number of messages" seems to imply "get exactly 10". Which is it?
@KannarFr what is pulsar4s-avro? Is this a library?
@KannarFr can you try first with just consuming and producing with the official java client?

@jerrypeng 

> @KannarFr what is pulsar4s-avro? Is this a library?

It's a pulsar4s sub part to manage avro decode/encode.

> @KannarFr can you try first with just consuming and producing with the official java client?

Will do it.

@KannarFr 

I would suggest you using the java client to consume the AVRO messages to verify if java client can consume the AVRO messages produced by the function context. This would help you understand if the issue is from pulsar4s. If the problem only exists in pulsar4s, you should consult the pulsar4s author for the fix.

retest this please

@KannarFr the consumer will reading the schema of the version associated with the message it received. so it seems that the consumer stucks at reading the schema info. 

- what version of broker and client?
- any error logs at the broker side?
- any error logs at the client side?
- can you get a jstack of your test application?

@sijie I found this issue in reading through `pulsar` not production. What this issue reporting is not-owned-by bundles, eg. bundles that were owned by other brokers, were selected due to  broker overloading, not inconsistent between `LocalBrokerData.getBundles` and `LoadData.getBundleData`.

I think the testing code is somewhat confusing, may be better to bind ownerless bundles to a not overloaded broker ?

Oh just remember about the version brokers v2.5.0-SNAPSHOT from monday (to handle the fix on schema deletion). Bookies are v2.4.0.
